website_summaries.verdict: For such a flat bulb, the SlimStyle is surprisingly well-rounded, making for a decent value at its price point.
pros: The oddly-shaped Philips SlimStyle is a value-priced LED that serves as a respectable incandescent replacement
The flat design helps it manage heat better than other LEDs
cons: The SlimStyle gives off an annoying buzz if you use it with a dimmer switch
Also, the three-year warranty isn't as good as the 10 years you get from the Cree LED, which costs just a dollar more

customer_reviews.title: Very Warm light
customer_reviews.text: These are great lights. I was a bit worried about the unorthodox shape that they have, but I really kind of like it now that it's installed. I had to be a little bit careful when installing them because I really wanted them to all be aligned since they're sort of flat. The quality of the light was surprising to me, it's somewhat more orange looking than other soft white lights, definitely warmer than I'm used to, but everything looks great in the light these produce. Given that the light temperature is so much warmer than most other lights i've seen I would try to avoid putting these in an area with other soft white lights.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Williams

customer_reviews.title: They should still make these.
customer_reviews.text: I really liked these flat bulbs when they came out. Now, they are hard to find, if at all. I’ve put these in many fixtures. They seem to last, have a soft light , and fit into tight areas, and bases don’t get hot. They are outstanding in outdoor fixtures. LED are suppose to last 23 years, I haven’t seen any of the first generation of LED last past 5. Maybe these will be the exception.
customer_reviews.author: larry b

customer_reviews.title: Unique design elements make this a very useful bulb. 1) It is mostly flat on 2 ...
customer_reviews.text: Unique design elements make this a very useful bulb. 1) It is mostly flat on 2 sides making it a low profile fit in things like ceiling fixtures and also making it very easy to screw/unscrew. 2) The white part is some sort of plastic and probably won't shatter when dropped on even a hardwood or tile floor. 3) The LEDs are located along the edge of the device but do a great job of evenly illuminating the entire bulb 4) Priced very competitively with other LED bulbs The only downside is that the Lutron LED/CFL compatible dimmer switch that I bought causes these to hum when dimmed.
customer_reviews.author: The Mad Hatter

customer_reviews.title: Love this! Very cool Looking and Works!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really cool light bulb. I admit I wanted to try it because it looked so interesting and it said it worked with dimmable lights so I ordered it. I love it for my dimmable lights, it works great and I don't hear any buzzing unless I put my ear right up to the lamp (even with other light bulbs I heard a buzzing). The light that comes off it is great and bright. When my other lamp, that is not dimmable, went out I ordered this light bulb for it. I think I may eventually replace all my light bulbs in the house with this!
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Dimmable? Technically...
customer_reviews.text: I bought several of these to put in a single fixture because they say they're dimmable. Well, while technically true, the actual results are disappointing. Before you launch out against me, I tried three different dimmers, one was specifically for LEDs, and all of them yield a flickering, humming, BUZZING mess. The best part is if you have them dimmed and something on the same circuit kicks on that draws even a modicum of current, the lights go out. You have to go and brighten them back up then lower again to desired level. For non dimmable applications however, these excel.
customer_reviews.author: James M.

customer_reviews.title: The best I've used so far.
customer_reviews.text: I've tried several LED builds from smaller, lesser known companies because I didn't want to support a super-corporation like Phillips. However, all 5 of the bulbs I purchased from Lighting Ever were defective, and they promptly issued a refund. (Great customer service; noteworthy) I ended up buying a box of these, and I'm impressed so far. They probably won't last 25 years like most of the manufacturers are claiming lately, but they definitely seem to be of unsurpassed quality and value. I have recommended these to friends and family. I really can't complain here, as the bulbs are sturdy, well made, and efficient. They look sleek too!
customer_reviews.author: Monkey Frazzler

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic, nearly identical to Ikea Ledare but no buzzing
customer_reviews.text: Great bulbs, no issue with buzzing even when dimmed, in fact they saved the day when my standard Ikea Ledare E26 bulbs (which cost a third as much) buzzed horribly in one particular fixture (strangely, not in others). The light quality of the soft white SlimStyle Philips is nearly identical to the Ledare, a nice warm tone similar to an old school incandescent (not the horrible pink you sometimes get with LED bulbs). I'm very happy to have this option to mix and match throughout my home, wherever the cheaper Ikea bulbs won't work. Only docked one star since they cost more, but really they are terrific bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Allana D

customer_reviews.title: A great LED bulb for household use
customer_reviews.text: I received last week the '40-watt' daylight version of this bulb. It's in my desk light now, works great. The multi-LED design gives a balanced light output, with more down-light than is typical with LED household bulbs. The color temp is excellent and light dispersion is very good. I've used it daily for about a week and have found nothing to criticize. Light output (lumens) easily is 40-watt equivalent. Size is comparable to standard incandescent bulb, same medium base of course. It makes a terrific desk light. It runs cool/cold. Five stars. I'll likely buy a couple more.
customer_reviews.author: J. Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Good value, with caveats
customer_reviews.text: These bulbs are definitely bright and efficient, though not the most efficient ones out there. They are definitely brighter, though, than the other LED bulbs we've tried that purport to have the same illumination level. The main drawback to them, though, is the "flat" shape, which isn't not compatible with some of our lamp shades. We thus, have had to find a different style of lampshade for a couple of our fixtures. The labels also discourage putting these bulb in a full-enclosed fixture (e.g. recessed lights with a globe or cover-pane). I definitely like how much more durable these bulbs are in closets, as we were often accidentally breaking those toxic CFLs.
customer_reviews.author: KSed

customer_reviews.title: SQUEALS LIKE A PIG!
customer_reviews.text: Ended up returning these because they emitted a high-pitch squealing noise as they were dimmed and an even worse squealing when they were full on. An "electrician" in Home Depot told me that I had faulty ground wiring, but being an electrical guru myself I knew he was full of it. I returned all of these and bought the CREE 60W models instead which are outstanding. If you are thinking about buying these, do not waste your time.
customer_reviews.author: Allan R

customer_reviews.title: Good LED "bulb". (Somewhat dimmable.)
customer_reviews.text: This light has 32 LEDs in the outer ring of this light. Light appears to be evenly distributed. It could replace a 60W light. I tried it in a fixture for 5 40W bulbs, and it turned out to be too bright. This fixture has a dimmer, and the Philips dimmed pretty quietly, but stayed fairly bright (compared to the incandescent bulbs) until it cut out. This is what I call "somewhat dimmable". I'm using this light in hard-to-replace areas, like the porch light and garage door opener. I may buy more of these, but am also waiting to see what other new bulb designs come out. I saw a 40W version in a hardware store. -Chris
customer_reviews.author: Christophe

customer_reviews.title: These bulbs perform great, and have a color output that is indistinguishable ...
customer_reviews.text: These bulbs perform great, and have a color output that is indistinguishable from traditional incandescents. The dimming functionality is not amazing, but unlike non-dimmable versions, they will work on dimmer switches, and can be dimmed to maybe 50% of the normal brightness. Although they look weird, they perform great in fixtures, as the light shines both up and down from the rim of the bulbs. I recommend getting the 75w equivelent (~1100 lumens), unless you are quite sure that your home is bright enough. The soft white is the color you are probably used to in your home, the Daylight color will probably remind you of florescent or office lighting. I do not recommend mixing them within a room.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Functionally beautiful solution.
customer_reviews.text: I have used these in applications where they are exposed to see (open barn, garage, basement, andin some carriage lights) and they produce a great light that is not blinding to the eyes. Disperses the light very evenly. Some LED bulbs really need to be behind a shade. Much much cooler running as well than other LED buls I have used. As stated, a great engineering solution. Sure they are a bit weird looking but I like the lollipop look. Have used ton 75 watt equivalent to replace a dual 40 watt florescent fixture.
customer_reviews.author: Mark T.

customer_reviews.title: These Drive Me CRAZY
customer_reviews.text: I've alway been impressed with Philips in the past, but I have lost a lot of confidence after my experience with these bulbs. I purchased a few dozen of these after testing one out, and all seemed well. Over the last month and a half, though, the buzzing sound emanating from these bulbs has become more pronounced. It's to so loud now that I cannot stand to even have them turned on, which defeats the whole purpose of the bulbs! Unfortunately, Amazon's return policy states that I am beyond the date to return them. I highly suggest you choose better bulbs!
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Best LED yet - the shape gives it the winning ...
customer_reviews.text: Best LED yet - the shape gives it the winning edge over the also-great Cree TW-series bulbs. The Phillips gives bright, true light. The flat-bulb shape is very handy and fits more fixtures than the round LED bulbs with the large bases. This bulb fits in shallow fixtures where other LED's are too large (girth-wise.) They also give a more "bulb-like" shape inside light fixtures and lamp shades because the diodes are arranged in a horseshoe. Although some buzzing while dimming has been reported, I've found them essentially silent when compared to the Costco 60-watt equivalent LED dimmables that they replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Ingil

customer_reviews.title: good light color, good light pattern, great on energy, but some odd clicking noises when turning off
customer_reviews.text: This light looks great in our kitchen and breakfast area. It is indistinguishable from the regular lights we had used before and every time I turn them on I get some happiness from knowing that I'm using 15% of the power I used before. You do want to have these in a shade or something similar to hide the odd shape of the bulb, although the light pattern itself looks totally normal and evenly distributed. We have heard some loud clicking coming from the bulbs when we turn the lights off, which is a bit disconcerting. I don't know if this is normal or not, but all of the bulbs I've purchased (5 of them) do it to some degree.
customer_reviews.author: freethinker

customer_reviews.title: Failed well before "22.8 years rated average life"
customer_reviews.text: Nice light, and it made it past its 3-year warranty. (Lasted five years and one month.) Used in a desk lamp a few hours a day, powered through a major-brand uninterruptible power source with surge protection. Pffft.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It does not dim in some fixtures, does in others.
customer_reviews.text: The bulb is either off, or on full brilliance, controlled by the dimmer of my Casablanca ceiling fan, which it fits just fine. Other bulbs in the same fixture (traditional incandescent, LED) dim as expected. It is "compatible" with that dimmer, but it does NOT dim. The Levitron dimmer of my dining-room's lights dims this bulb fairly well, though the other lights dim further, leaving this Philips bulb much brighter. The shape isn't really a bulb! It is a U (or omega) that follows the outline of a standard glass bulb; the center has deflated. While not the traditional shape, it's easy to hold when inserting into, and removing from the awkward, tight glass shades of the ceiling fan.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Rawson

customer_reviews.title: LED and a way better form factor Thanks Philips!
customer_reviews.text: for those that are concerned about the shape of these bulbs and how they look, over the next few days pay attention to how often you look at any of your light bulbs other then the dim decorative type. I love these smaller and easier to hold and install we have at least 15 in our home. The only reason I don't give them 5 stars is that maybe once a week I notice them flickering it is very slight hardly noticeable and only lasts about a minute. My wife (god love her) is very picky about these things and has never complained about this issue. I have and will by more after noticing this very minor issue.
customer_reviews.author: serac

customer_reviews.title: Odd shaped but great light output.
customer_reviews.text: They are oddly shaped, but I didn't buy them for their shape. They are slightly wider than a standard bulb so the covers for some of our lights would not fit over them, but they are old fixtures and we don't like them so we will be replacing them anyways. They do throw out a nice soft white light and don't have to warm up like curly cue CFL bulbs, come on instantly (unlike old CFL that have a delay before they come on), and they draw less power too (electricity $avings, lol). I am completely satisfied with them and plan to switch the whole house over to them, though.
customer_reviews.author: Jon M.

customer_reviews.title: 5 watt Slim style dimmable light bulb is the most awesome LED bulb I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: The Philips 10.5 watt Slim style dimmable light bulb is the most awesome LED bulb I've ever owned. It has a concave shape and very cool design. It keep the original idea light bulb shape with a new sense of style. It dims like a night light and brighten and shines like a star in the night. It's very bright and this bulb is in soft weight, so it's easy on the eyes. It's supposed to last 22.8 years, so we'll see if Philips keeps their promise. Overall, great investment. Pricey for a light bulb, but fair priced for a LED energy efficient bulb. I'll do another review in a year or 2 or 22. =D
customer_reviews.author: Sexy Sonya

customer_reviews.title: It stays cool and puts out a very bright blue/white light. Five years and still going.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this bulb since 2015 and it has worked flawlessly. It is now 2020 still working. I used this bulb in the canister outlet in the center of my living-room. It stays cool and puts out a very bright blue/white light. This light is switched on first thing in the morning, stays on for fifteen hours until I go to bed. I would have used 5 CFL's by now. Big money saver.
customer_reviews.author: Vickerman

customer_reviews.title: Strange shape but sturdy and bright
customer_reviews.text: Bright and sturdy LED bulbs. They are made with a plastic shell (instead of glass) which is good. I haven't dropped one yet but they look like they would survive a moderate impact with the floor. On the downside, these bulbs are flat. Aside from looking really weird, the light is unevenly distributed compared to symmetrical round bulbs. That's really not a problem in most fixtures but I can imagine situations where it would matter.
customer_reviews.author: robosolo

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: These are great... very bright. Am using in the kitchen and they are perfect. I think for a living or bedroom you might want something slightly warmer (I'm using Feit Electric - 60 Watt - they dim perfectly and are warm), but they are extremely bright and I'm happy. The dimming is okay, and am not noticing any flicker or sound, but I want to wait until I put in an LED dimmer before fully commenting on that. I might even raise to 5 starts if it works well. With conventional dimmer it doesn't go down very far, which is fine for the kitchen, but am waiting to see if that improves.
customer_reviews.author: James F

customer_reviews.title: Great light, durable, but cause RF interference
customer_reviews.text: These bulbs are very durable and put out a wonderful quality of light, and they work very well with a dimmer.The unique shape has not presented any trouble in any of the fixtures I have installed them in. On the negative side, they cause radio frequency interference. If you like to listen to the radio or watch TV using an antenna, you'll have to turn off lights nearby with these bulbs. I have found that the interference drops off over a pretty short range, so it's not a big deal to work around.
customer_reviews.author: Matt H.

customer_reviews.title: Great desklight!
customer_reviews.text: This light works nicely in my desktop banker's lamp. It has a pleasant hue to the light that doesn't wear on the eyes and creates a pleasant atmosphere. The bulb illuminates in such a way that it works even better than a comparable CFC bulb. I'll be replacing my lights in the house with these overtime. My only complaint is how the bulb can get hot. While the bulb is still cool enough to handle, it does get significantly hotter than my other LED bulbs (made by the new defunct SWITCH company). This is surprising considering that this bulb uses less power and is dimmer.
customer_reviews.author: K. Foster

customer_reviews.title: Nice bulbs
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to use in an Adesso dimmable torchierre lamp, but that lamp quit working and I had to return it, leaving me with two of these bulbs. Still, the bulbs themselves are great. They are the same size as regular bulbs, but oddly flat. Inside a lamp you can't really tell, and they provide nice light, and are dimmable. Plus they were far less expensive than other offerings here on Amazon. They worked great, even though now I'm not using them since I don't have a lamp anymore to use them in.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Turner

customer_reviews.title: Omnidirectional & evenly distributed - A pleasing version of Warm White color - Hope it's long lived
customer_reviews.text: This Philips 10.5-watt Slim Style works great and the Warm White color is pleasing...definitely not as yellow as the CFL version of Warm White. Though the LED's run along the edge of the bulb, the light is quite omnidirectional AND evenly distributed, at least in a lamp with a shade. I just hope the thing lasts as long as advertised. I do prefer the even-less-yellow Bright White color and wish this line of bulb was available in that color. I also wish the 75-watt equiv. version of the bulb wasn't, for some reason, so much more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Virgin User

customer_reviews.title: I love the colour that the bulb gives off and the ...
customer_reviews.text: We have been replacing our CF with these! I have 3 outside and 2 indoors at the time of this review. I love the colour that the bulb gives off and the spread. It looks just like having an old incandescence bulb which is what I was looking for. The outdoor lights are on dusk till dawn for the past 3 months (a very wet fall and winter) and I have not had an issue. I have not put them in a dimming light yet so I cannot speak for the supposed sound that they give off. If it's bad, I will update my review!
customer_reviews.author: Bassndrumboy

customer_reviews.title: Very strange looking light bulb
customer_reviews.text: As the headline suggest this is the strangest light bulb I have ever seen and I was actually wondering if it would work. Well it does and compared to another dimmable LED bulb I have it seemed to be a bit brighter. I don't have a lux meter but I do have a very accurate Sekonic L-358. Measuring both bulbs in ambient mode they appear to produce the same amount of light. The bulb I already had cost about $15.00 this is $8.00. In addition the height is lower so it fits in the harp easily.
customer_reviews.author: Richard J.

customer_reviews.title: I love these lights !!
customer_reviews.text: I love these lights !! The body is slim - and made of a plastic type of non-glass material. So - no worry of broken glass. The light is very bright - and they do not get hot. Also - these specific models cast very white light - perfect for reading and actually seeing. For me - much better than the "yellow" of ordinary light bulbs. All of this on top of the low wattage (low cost of operation) and longevity of LED lights !!
customer_reviews.author: DFilbert

customer_reviews.title: Low heat great price.
customer_reviews.text: These bulbs look weird but work great. The have the same glow as an incandescent, and the light output is even like an incandescent. The thing that I love about this bulb is it does not get as hot as other LED bulbs that I have. For the price I am now starting to replace other LED bulbs just because of the heat.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: I'm buying more of these..!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these bulbs 13W (like 75W) as a trial for a ceiling lamp and I'm very satisfied. This is my first LED lightbulb so I was very cautios since I always hated those ice white lights in a home envrionment. This one makes a great light like older bulbs. Not too yellowish nor ice white. It also makes very powerful light. Just one warning. It is rather big. It's profile is a little bigger than a regular (old) bulb (just flatter), so it might not fit at some lamps.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Bates

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great value
customer_reviews.text: These bulbs are great. Reasonably priced (although I later found them even cheaper at my local Home Depot), instant-on, dimmable and great light (both brightness and color). There is a bit of "buzzing" when they are dimmed in my lights, but not loud enough for me to notice unless I am specifically trying to hear it. The warmer color of these bulbs is nice compared to the harsh white light that some of my older CFLs would give off. No complaints so far, and I'm curious to see how long they last.
customer_reviews.author: Troy S

customer_reviews.title: Best LED bulb for table lamps I've seen
customer_reviews.text: The color temperature is perfect. I've photographed it next to my other tungsten lamps and measured its temp which is very close without any odd color spikes. The look is very pleasing. The light distribution is very nice. I would like to get an IES profile for this bulb to use it in lighting simulations that I do. Others have complained about the buzzing. I hear none in the unit I bought. I have not tried dimming it yet but I installed special Lutron dimmers in my house that have trims for LED lamps. I will test and add comments. So far so good, though. I am planning on buying a bunch more.
customer_reviews.author: P. deLappe

customer_reviews.title: My Bulb's Lifetime and Warranty Info Ques
customer_reviews.text: Hi folks, I bought this bulb on June 11, 2014 and it died today May 24, 2019 (Just short of 5 yrs when it has a listed lifetime of 22.8 years ) Is this still under warranty??? Couldn't find any good info on that... It's been in use at one location as the main light within my bedroom. So it would not have been exposed to adverse weather conditions and it would have be used only when needed... Wish i got a bit more life and if I were buying it again maybe a bit more light output at full brightness as well....
customer_reviews.author: Ras Irie

customer_reviews.title: The ceiling light in my shower went out. I ...
customer_reviews.text: The ceiling light in my shower went out. I wanted a bulb I wouldn't have to replace for a long time and also had a warmer color. This worked perfectly, its not too bright for my early morning showers, yet its bright enough as to allow me to not mistakenly grab my glass door squeegee instead of the showering loofa. The "slim" style it refers to is the width. It's as if you took a regular round bulb, heated the glass and smashed it down to about a half in wide. It will still be as tall and have the depth of a regular bulb, it just won't be as wide. Hope that makes sense.
customer_reviews.author: Gize

customer_reviews.title: Good in certain places.
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so interesting experience putting these in. I bought these for my kitchen light which has 3 bulbs upside down. When I first put the first bulb in, it wouldn't light up. So to test it I put it in a regular living room lamp, and it lit up. So I tried it back in the kitchen light, and it worked. Same thing for the second bulb. But the third absolutely would not light in the kitchen no matter what I did. I have since moved these bulbs to other fixtures where they work just fine, and put different LED bulbs in my kitchen, which also work just fine. The light from these is a nice, pleasant, warm light.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice bright light.
customer_reviews.text: I like the colder bluish led lights better than the warm yellowish light. It seems more daylight like. During short, dark, and cold winter months, this light feels nice. It has an uplifting effect on my mood. As my incandescent bulbs die out, I think I'll replace them with these bulbs. The price is right and they use very little amperage. Some reviews have complained about the shape and the way it projects the light. I use it in a tall floor lamp, so it projects light just fine for me. I am happy.
customer_reviews.author: SPB

customer_reviews.title: Works well, runs cool, but creates radio interference for some FM frequencies
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work as advertised, is lighter than most other LED bulbs due to lack of metal heat sink. HOWEVER, at about six feet from my FM radio I am unable to listen to certain radio stations because of radio interference, until I turn off the "bulb." This is a problem I've never experienced with this component amplifier / radio in the 30+ years I've been using it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Franklin

customer_reviews.title: good bright white lamps
customer_reviews.text: odd shape, good bright white lamps, low priced in some fixtures the lamps flat-sided bulb shape doesn't matter, however in some fixtures it would be nice if the lamps could be screwed securely into the lamp socket and then rotated back up to a half turn to align all the bulbs flat sides to be the same...this would allow for some minimal adjustment of maximum light output direction and in my case at least allow the lamps to aligned for aesthetic purposes. I could achieve this by rotating the sockets in some cases but not others but its a minor pain to go to this effort
customer_reviews.author: m spence

customer_reviews.title: Strange shape but great light
customer_reviews.text: This flattened traditional shape bulb gives a nice bright light. The flat shape is not like any other LED bulb that I have and is rather curious looking. The light output and color are the important things and this bulb delivers. I plan on using it for a few weeks and then buying additional bulbs to replace some CFL's. I tried 3 different 60 watt equivalent LED bulbs and this one is the Winner.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Smiles

customer_reviews.title: Not a cheesy light
customer_reviews.text: These bulbs have an odd shape, but they are very bright and don't get hot. I would not recommend these in any fixture with a bulbous visible, but since I use them in fixtures with lampshades, this does not make a difference. They are also made out of plastic, so that if you drop one on the floor, it won't shatter into a million pieces. The color of the light they emit is also quite pleasing. We use it in our bathroom among other places. When you look in the mirror under this light, the image staring back at you doesn't look like it is made out of some pale cheese.
customer_reviews.author: Armin A. Wolff

customer_reviews.title: Two bulbs both had buzzing issues and weren't as warm white as expected.
customer_reviews.text: We ordered two of the "60 Watt Equivalent Soft White High CRI" ones. Both of them made a buzzing sound and we had to return them. The sound wasn't loud, but loud enough to be noticeable in a quiet room if you're sitting near it. We tried it in two different types of dimmers and both did the same thing. The second issue was that it wasn't as warm white as expected for a 2700k bulb. Our Cree 60W Equivalent Soft White 2700K A19 TW Series bulb was noticeably slightly warmer (more like an incandescent bulb).
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: I like these, and will be ordering more
customer_reviews.text: I like these, and will be ordering more. I was going through cheap Chinese incandescents in my living room for the last year, and finally got sick of replacing the bulbs. It's only been a month with the LED, but I like them so far. I was concerned about noise from them when on a standard dimmer, but don't notice anything. They aren't as fully dimable as an incandescent, but they work well down to about 50% brightness, and then sort of cut off. It works for me.
customer_reviews.author: James Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Good looking, bad sounding with dimmer
customer_reviews.text: This bulb's light is outstanding, with a beautiful non-yellowing, non-glaring quality. However it has two downsides: *the light is dispersed unevenly, and a part of the bulb's casing actually casts a shadow you can see *It buzzes like crazy when used with a dimmer, no matter what the dimmer's set to. It's like a swarm of tiny bees are in your fixture.
customer_reviews.author: Jibbonte

customer_reviews.title: The future is here. In this light bulb!
customer_reviews.text: This light bulb is funky man. We are living in the future now. The ironic thing is I bought it cause the light bulb I had in the lamp rolled off the table when I had it out of the fixture adjusting the shade. So I order this replacement and its flat, which I didn't pick up on from the pic. So no more rolling off tables for this lamp!
customer_reviews.author: MCM

customer_reviews.title: Very close to a standard 75 watt bulb
customer_reviews.text: If this lasts as long as they claim it will, then it is an excellent product. The quality of light is very similar to what you would get from a "soft" incandescent 75 watt bulb. It works with a dimmer (although not as well as incandescents do - there is a brief hiccup between no light and a little bit of light). I did not notice any humming noise with it, and the color is not harsh the way it is with some LED bulbs. I'm already seeing some savings in my electrical bills.
customer_reviews.author: T. Burrows

customer_reviews.title: Not to be eaten!
customer_reviews.text: As much as these look like pastries, they are not to be eaten. I can't stress that enough. DO NOT EAT THESE. That said, they are absolutely wonderful light bulbs. It seems expensive at first, but look how much you spend replacing cheap incandescent bulbs over the same life time? That doesn't even take into account savings on the electric bill. But really, a lot of people are more worried about the quality of light. Honestly, I think they are pretty good. Not at all the weird too white light I've come to expect from newer style energy efficient bulbs. Oh, it's not sunlight coming in through the window, but they're great for your living room lamps.
customer_reviews.author: eroo

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product
customer_reviews.text: I'm impressed! This bulb puts out a nice natural light- not glaring, not too "soft", just right. It diffuses the light just like a conventional bulb. It does not work with my 3-way lamp, only having on/off ability. But it does work well with an infinite dimmer- and, it works with my 2 way kitchen vent hood light, putting out dimmer or brighter light just like a regular light bulb. My 3-way lamp is pretty old, that might have something to do with it. For the energy saving over conventional lighting, LED's are the way to go
customer_reviews.author: Floydo

customer_reviews.title: You'd Never Know It's an LED Bulb
customer_reviews.text: This bulb has a funny flat shape, like a deflated ballon, but it's wonderfully bright. It's brighter, I think, than a comparable 60-watt incandescent bulb. It comes on instantly at full brightness, no delay whatsoever. The description says it's dimmable, but I don't have it on a dimmer circuit so I can't comment on that feature. Otherwise I love it and will probably get more as I gradually convert all my incandescent bulbs to LED. Now if they only made a 3-way LED...
customer_reviews.author: M. Spalmacin

customer_reviews.title: very different
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty cool light bulbs, and I didn't even think a lightbulb could be cool. The are not glass at all, but a hard plastic. They are also flat. It seems like the led light is in the center. I was worried if it'd actually be bright enough and put off good light in all directions, and it does. I would even realize it was a different type of bulb in there if I didn't know it. I bought it because it's a dimmer light as well, and that functionality word great. I think we'll be buying more of these in the future, after we see if the life expectancy lives up to its promise.
customer_reviews.author: sweetnjt

customer_reviews.title: Signs of things to come - good signs!
customer_reviews.text: Some of the standard A19 fixtures won't play well with this device, some of the lamps that fit standard incandescent bulbs won't fit these easily (if at all); yet, they are stable,bright, lights with good color balance. I've been using one group of these for about a year now without one fault. That is - by far - better demonstration of performance than I ever received from a broad spectrum of CFLs I'd tried before LEDs started coming in line for price parity.
customer_reviews.author: Merle ApAmber

customer_reviews.title: 4 Years In, Still Best LED Bulb I've Bought
customer_reviews.text: Dims well without flicker. (Doesn't get quite as dim as I'd want but that may be the switch...) Nice, fairly warm light. Still going strong after 4y in one of the lamps we use most in the home.
customer_reviews.author: Peter K

customer_reviews.title: Decent dimmable bulb but won't fit in tight spaces
customer_reviews.text: I think the round Philips bulbs put out a better overall light, but they aren't bad. I do think the light output is more yellow than their regular bulbs. Watch out if you want to put these in outdoor lights that just have an opening for a bulb. Most likely these won't fit. I had this happen, so I'm now using them in my garage.
customer_reviews.author: Merrell

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful ... works on Light timers eventhough box says no
customer_reviews.text: Although the box says "not to be used with timers", it works with our timers since our timers require bulbs that are dimmable, and these are dimmable. This 60w equivalent is a little brighter than our GE 60w bulbs but they are wonderful. Using them on Light Timers and they work perfectly because these are dimmable. Liked them so much bought 3 more 60w equivalents and 2 40w equivalents. This is a real quality product. Will keep replacing other bulbs in the house with these. Got tired of replacing bulbs... and love the fact that these bulbs use less energy.
customer_reviews.author: SmallBizOwner

customer_reviews.title: My choice for indoor use
customer_reviews.text: A couple of months ago I decided to convert the the CFLs at my home to LED. So I bought one of these and a Cree to see which one I liked better. I went with the Philips for indoor use. They are doing very well so far. They turn on immediately and produce a warm comfortable light. I use a two-bulb fixture where I need more light. I went with the Cree for my outdoor lighting. The Cree is not rated for outdoor use but all my outdoor fixtures keep the bulbs from getting wet so they are doing fine. I'm glad to be rid of the CFLs.
customer_reviews.author: James Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Great substitution for energy wasting bulbs
customer_reviews.text: These replace 3 conventional 60 watt bulbs over a dining table used every evening with dimmer controlled lighting. The incandescent bulbs would hum a little when set for less than full brightness. These have been totally silent. They work fine with the dimmer over the same range. I would say maximum brightness is slightly less than with the original bulbs. But it is more than sufficient. Downsizing from 180 to 33 watts plus the very long life seems like a fair trade to me! Nice design and the light temp. is right on.
customer_reviews.author: DynoShip

customer_reviews.title: Breakage Resistant
customer_reviews.text: This bulb was put into a Trouble Light & used for a car repair job. It was dropped several times and banged around a good bit. It lit up the work area well & I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Linda J.

customer_reviews.title: I like to be able to set the level to low ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Although if I remember correctly, this was rated as a 100-watt replacement at the time of my order. It is plenty bright and lights up my room very well. I like to be able to set the level to low late at night and first thing in the morning. Normally I keep it at half level or less unless I'm looking for something or working on a project.
customer_reviews.author: Redwood Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Best so far!
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying LED bulbs as soon as they came out on the market about 5 years ago. My house is now 98% LED lighting. These new Phillips flat bulbs are the best by far. Price and performance, I can't find anything better. They're dimmable and that is very important in LED lighting because they tolerate small power surges in the house unlike non-dimmables. They also have a warm glow that matches the feel of incandescent bulbs. Some people say they can hear them. It maybe because I'm over 40, but I can't hear them unlike some other LED bulbs I have.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin H

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to CFLs...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bulb and very bright. However I found other 10W LED with 60W equivalence here on Amazon, sold in 5-packs for much less per bulb. If you only need 1 or 2 this is OK, but I am buying in bulk to replace all the bulbs in my house. I don't like the CFL light quality and the heat and safety issues of CFL bases, especially if used enclosed in a glass shade such as my closet, hallway, or pantry areas. LED last much longer, have no safety issues, and give better light quality instantly than CFLs.
customer_reviews.author: Hobbyist

customer_reviews.title: Long bulb. Doesn't fit all enclosures.
customer_reviews.text: The bulb has good diffusion, a warm light temperature, and I detect zero jitter/flicker. I especially like that you can get more lumens (brightness) out of your socket because it uses less watts. I used this bulb in a socket rated for a 60 watt incandescent bulb so I got more light and stayed below the requirement (this bulb uses 13 watts). It should be noted, however, that these are LONGER THAN STANDARD BULBS by a fair amount. It wouldn't fit in the enclosure for my overhead lamp I originally intended to buy this for.
customer_reviews.author: a.valentine

customer_reviews.title: Love the, especialy the bright white!
customer_reviews.text: Very bright for the price and perfect color of light, not to glaing whight and not yo warm yellow, perfect mix of both. Amazingly compact for the brightness and very cool to the touch. I would recoment the bright white and not the soft white, The soft white is a little too soft (yellow) the bright white is a perfect mix, to too glaring white, but soft enough to be comfortable to he eyes yet bright enough to put out the maximum amount of white light. I bought one soft white and three bright white lights. So I speak for exsperence. (About the soft/bright lights anyway!
customer_reviews.author: Rich Patrino

customer_reviews.title: Good general purpose dimmable bulbs
customer_reviews.text: Works very well, and for an excellent price. Light distribution is very even, and color is good. When dimming, as others have noted there is a slight buzzing noise, but at least for me it is not detectable unless your ear is within 1-2ft of the bulb. Minimum dimmable brightness appears to be around 20% of max. One odd thing: After dimming all the way down and switching off, each bulb emits a loud click a second or two later.
customer_reviews.author: vexo

customer_reviews.title: Great bulb with no flickering while dimming
customer_reviews.text: Needed a dim-able bulb for an overhead fixture in the house. While these may look odd, they project light very well and don't have any flickering issues that some cheaper LED bulbs do. These may be a bit more expensive, but definitely are worth the little bit of extra price. Phillips makes a quality bulb product, and I continue to use their LED bulbs in the house and their halogen bulbs in my car headlights without issues.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine for FOUR nights.
customer_reviews.text: It was working fine for 4 (FOUR) nights, and a couple of hours at much each night, then suddenly, when I turned my lamp on in the fifth night the LEDs glowed faintly, and that was it. It just appears as if it was dimmed to the lowest setting, but it isn't, in fact, I don't have a single dimmer in my house! Sadly, I was expecting this to be among the best LED bulbs I have purchased, but, it is the worst so far.
customer_reviews.author: Roberto Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Good looking with soft efficient light
customer_reviews.text: This bulb is energy efficient but looks nice so they can go on a lamp or ceiling fan where the bulb is viewed. The light it gives off us bright yet soft.
customer_reviews.author: North Shore Gal

customer_reviews.title: These bulbs are great. Nice color temperature
customer_reviews.text: These bulbs are great. Nice color temperature, instant on, bright, and they don't even get hot after running for a while (pretty warm to the touch, but you won't burn your hand). I also like that the bulb is made of a thick plastic in order to prevent it from shattering or breaking. They might look a little funky if you have them bare, but once you put them behind a shade or cover it's virtually impossible to tell the difference. I don't have these bulbs on a dimmer so I can't comment on their performance there. Overall I am very happy with these bulbs so far.
customer_reviews.author: diegoz281

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't get very dim
customer_reviews.text: Paid extra for this "dimmable" version, but at the dimmest setting it's still very bright. I'd say on minimum power it is still 80% as bright as at full power. Other bulbs have worked fine in the same lamp, going fully dim. I don't have the same buzzing issue so many others have complained about. But if you want dimmable, definately avoid this one.
customer_reviews.author: New Creations

customer_reviews.title: Great for price.
customer_reviews.text: Stays cool, nice and bright. I have it in window with some clearance between shade and glass to keep porch and yard lit up.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: This bulb fits just fine. The only caveat of this bulb is when ...
customer_reviews.text: I was planning on using this bulb in my garage door opener. Many non-incandescent bulbs widen to much at the base and won't fit into the socket of my opener. This bulb fits just fine. The only caveat of this bulb is when using it on a dimmer. It does not dim nearly as much as an incandescent. Also, it buzzes when dimmed. So I may use this in closets in my house in the future, but not for dimmers. Assuming this bulb can handle rough duty, this bulb should be just fine for a garage door opener.
customer_reviews.author: Summit Sidehiller

customer_reviews.title: The perfect LED bulb!
customer_reviews.text: Disclaimer: I've only had the bulb for 1 day. But I love it! It fit perfectly in our floor lamp. It turns on instantly, no delay like some of the cheaper LEDs. The color is more yellowish, exactly as if it was an old incadescent bulb. It is also a little brighter than the CFL bulb it replaced, but that was what we needed. Assuming this bulb doesn't die out way earlier than expected, I absolutely love it. I'll be buying more of these in the near future!
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: I use this funny looking bulb in an open ended reading lamp attached ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this funny looking bulb in an open ended reading lamp attached to a floor lamp. It throws off good lighting without toasting you in a reading lamp placed near your head. I bought this for a globe lamp, but it is too big for a standard globe type fixture, hence the 4 star rating. It will not fit everywhere your old incandescent bulbs work.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt S.

customer_reviews.title: MUCH WIDER THAN A REGULAR INCANDESCENT BULB, DID NOT FIT INTO MY LAMP
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a regular 60 watt incandescent but this is so large it would not fit inside the glass globe. Its a good inch wider than a regular bulb so make sure it will fit inside your lamp if you are thinking of buying it, I gave mine to a neighbor and he is using it inside a droplight. Only thing it will fit into.
customer_reviews.author: Happy with it!

customer_reviews.title: Bright light, no flickering, good for the environment. Captain Planet would be proud.
customer_reviews.text: What an odd looking lightbulb! They advertise 360° light output, and they aren't lying about that. However due to the aesthetics of such a peculiar you might want to keep this one hidden behind a lampshade. The instructions on the box indicate they aren't to be used in closed fixtures, but they fit so darned well in my ceiling light in the kitchen. These out off that cool blue hue of daylight, so these are the types of bulbs good for getting yourself energized and when you need clear viability. I wouldn't recommend these in any fixtures you might use before bedtime, as it may inhibit your body's natural production of melatonin.
customer_reviews.author: James Stec

customer_reviews.title: needs multiple size options...
customer_reviews.text: what i mean is that it would be nice if i could get the "bulb" part with a smaller diameter. I wanted to use this on my back porch, would not fit in my "glass" piece, which did have a "normal" bulb. I ended up putting it in the garage and on my front porch, they are bright! I like it though, keeps things honest at night! The fact that they last 23 years, makes this a wise investment, however I do not recommend these for small spaced lighting, like bathroom lighting or outdoor light, as they all have glass shading of some kind and this bulb will not fit all....otherwise, it's pretty sweet looking too! ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Jeffery E. Gezymalla

customer_reviews.title: Nice...bright...weird lookin' light bulb!
customer_reviews.text: Nice, bright weird lookin' light bulb! I so wish I would've bought more of these bulbs when they were under $7 but only ended up buying a pair. These bulbs are really bright and work well both indoors and outdoors. I'm constantly moving them around - from the bedroom, to the deck/patio and eventually the front door. And in all places it really lights up the place! Anyways, I want to say they are cheaper on Amazon that at your local department store so get a couple and enjoy the light!
customer_reviews.author: TheR3alDanny

customer_reviews.title: Quality product.
customer_reviews.text: These lights provide color similiar to a normal incandescent bulb. You almost cannot tell the difference when looking at a fixture with a normal bulb and these installed. The only problem that I noticed is that these bulbs do not dim nearly as good as an incandescent bulb. They will get to a dim setting (brighter than an incandescent) and then turn off. This is not that big of an issue for myself, since only one fixture these are installed in is dimmable. It may be an issue for some, though. I recommend you shop around as you can find these bulbs cheaper in stores.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph G

customer_reviews.title: Great for Church Chandeliers
customer_reviews.text: We are using 4 of these in each of our Church chandeliers in conjunction with adownlight. These unique-looking bulbs not only distribute great light to the Church, but also diffuse the light in such a way as to light up the side walls and ceiling, where sometimes additional "up lights" or directional lights are necessary to accomplish this.
customer_reviews.author: Book Glutton

customer_reviews.title: For the guy that gets tired of replacing bulbs....
customer_reviews.text: I found these lightbulbs to be the best energy efficient product on the market. The color is really similar to old incandescent lights and I have not had any issues with defects in roughly 5 months of usage. Funny enough, I had a light fixture that would constantly get turned on and off throughout the day and would blow through incandescent lights frequently. Once I put the Phillips LED in, I stopped having to replace the bulb every month. Note: I am not an environmentalist, just a guy that gets tired of replacing bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: AZTony

customer_reviews.title: Phillps Changing the Looks of Lighting
customer_reviews.text: I read about how the shape of things have changed in lighting with the introduction of the Philips LED bulb. Very nice bright light for reading and cool to the touch. What a great buy too. I will getting some more of these as I replace old bulbs in our lamps throughtout the house. Thanks for great product that does the job, electricity and the pocketbook too. You can't lose with this quality bright light by Philips and Consumer Reports gives them a thumbs up too.
customer_reviews.author: MarkSme

customer_reviews.title: Great Bright White
customer_reviews.text: These are great bright white bulbs I have been using outdoors for months now. I purchased them mainly for security lighting and they work great. I've even had neighbors asking me what kind they are so they could purchase them. They brighten my property quite a bit while saving me money. I'm looking to buy more of these and the soft white bulbs for all my lighting needs.
customer_reviews.author: MChi

customer_reviews.title: Better than CFC, in spite of cost.
customer_reviews.text: The cost of these bulbs were actually a bit less than what I've seen them sell for in other markets. They were well packaged & arrived intact. I immediately replaced CFC bulbs in both my bedroom & my parents' living room with these LED bulbs. The difference was quite marked: brighter, instant "on." I love not having to wait for them to warm up as is the case with the CFC. My only regret is that I bought the "soft white" version, and I think a brighter bulb would have been best.
customer_reviews.author: S. R. Hoover

customer_reviews.title: The warm white color is dead on like a incandescent bulb and quite bright
customer_reviews.text: The warm white color is dead on like a incandescent bulb and quite bright. Its almost hovering in the 75W range of light but we'll call it its rated 60W of light. Note it has 700 Lum printed on the bulb and the 40W light has 450 Lum printed on it. I really like it and it would honestly take a very long time of burning something at 10.5 watts of power to cost me much of anything. I am now planing on replacing most of the used lights in my house from CFL to LED. Bulbs are very sturdy and light evenly 270` around the bulb.
customer_reviews.author: Jon E

customer_reviews.title: Love Love Love these
customer_reviews.text: Love Love Love these! We purposely dropped one to see if it would break. It didn't. I can't believe we complained about all the lightball laws that were changing. Am very very very happy with all the next LED bulbs that have been invented. Remember the first energy saving bulbs shaped like a coil....uuuugh, disliked those so much because they would burn out AND mostly because they come on dim and get brighter over time. Love these bulbs. Have them in all over the house now and so far (4 months maybe) none have stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: RitaBee

customer_reviews.title: Insteon
customer_reviews.text: Using with several dimmable Insteon switches. Works perfectly, with smooth dimming from 2% - 100%. I've got a half dozen of these and they all work correctly (smooth dimming, no flickering) with the following Insteon switches: - Dimmable OutletLinc (2472DWH) - Dimmable LampLinc (2457D2) - 6 Button KeypadLinc (2334-232) - 8 Button KeypadLinc (2334-222) - Dimmable ToggleLinc (2466DW)
customer_reviews.author: M. Doyle

customer_reviews.title: Would be nice to see similar package for 100W equivalent bulbs
customer_reviews.text: Works really well in limited space locations. Would be nice to see similar package for 100W equivalent bulbs. That was my original review - however, now that I actually installed one, I realize that these are "Daylight" type - much too brilliant white. I had intended to buy "soft White" but accidentally did not. Too late to return, so will have to discard - I can NOT use brilliant white.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly bright
customer_reviews.text: Love this bulb and will be buying more to replace in other fixtures. The only time I see issues is if you are looking at the bulb that has been dimmed by a dimmer. only then can you see the individual LED's. However how many of us actually spend time looking directly into a light bulb? In a regular fixture the room is lit and I can rest easy knowing that this will never leak any mercury like the CFL will. The flat surface also makes it easy to install and remove bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Tastychop

customer_reviews.title: Good, But Pricey Online
customer_reviews.text: We were looking to replace our light bulb in our living room that we leave on for many hours at a time. We wanted something energy efficient in that case and this fit what we were looking for. This bulb is pretty bright compared to the incandescent we replaced. One good thing about this bulb is that it doesn't buzz like many other bulbs would in our living room lamp. I just wish that these bulbs were cheaper online. My Home Depot has LED bulbs at a fraction of this cost.
customer_reviews.author: User

customer_reviews.title: Great light quality!
customer_reviews.text: I have recently changed out every light in our house with LED bulbs after finding several of the CFL type that had gone out after only a few years and had a melted look to them which made me very nervous. I have used these particular bulbs for most of the switch out and I am very happy with them. They are made from plastic, so there is no fear of breaking one, and the light quality is very pleasant. There is a very slight buzzing noise if the room is absolutely quiet but you have to be very close and most people would not even notice.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Great bulb, great price, bright and cool.
customer_reviews.text: Bright, instantaneous on. Great price for the product. I've read negatives on other LED bulbs that state that the light is uneven or shadowy (because of the design of the bulbs). This is definitely not the case here. One bulb on the ceiling lights the entire room without any issues. The heat output is inconsequential. After leaving this on for an extended period, I can touch it without any excessive heat discomfort. Should be safe around pets and children.
customer_reviews.author: Steve J.

customer_reviews.title: Bizarre behavior makes these bulbs useless
customer_reviews.text: Bizarre behavior by these bulbs: inserted several into a standard multi-bulb ceiling lamp on a wall-mounted dimmer (which the product description says these bulbs work in). When the switch is on the bulbs dim and brighten fine. BUT, truly weirdly, when I turn the switch to "off," the bulbs turn ON at a low brightness level. Strange and worthless behavior.
customer_reviews.author: WordLover

customer_reviews.title: Best LED bulb yet
customer_reviews.text: These slim bulbs give a great, warm colored light that is virtually indistinguishable from older incandescent bulbs. They dim very well in fixtures that support it. The base fits a standard light bulb base and has minimal ballast around it so you shouldn't encounter many fixtures where this will not fit. The low power consumption is great to reduce your energy costs and the low price will help you recoup the cost even faster.
customer_reviews.author: Dave B

customer_reviews.title: It seemed to work fine but one morning I got up and turned up ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this bulb for less than a month. It seemed to work fine but one morning I got up and turned up the light (since it is in a dimmable socket) and it just wasn't coming on. I tried turning it on and off, dimming it up and down, and finally it came back on. This morning it did it again and nothing I do gets it to come back on. If it does come back on, I'm still warning others to stay away with this review, unless you have time for a light bulb that sometimes doesn't come on.
customer_reviews.author: M. Dorre

customer_reviews.title: No noise from dimming!
customer_reviews.text: Using with Lighten Up! Model 308 Sunrise Simulator, and works perfectly. No noise from dimming, which is rare for led dimmables. Only wish I had bought a brighter model for this application, but works perfectly, and acts just like a regular light bulb as far as dimmers are concerned. The shape being flat may make it an interesting application in some lamps, but in most cases, its great..
customer_reviews.author: polishsausag

customer_reviews.title: Love These Bulbs. Price???
customer_reviews.text: I love these bulbs. Work well and fit in most fixtures. I am disappointed that the price in the last year or so as sky rocketed.
customer_reviews.author: Doug A.

customer_reviews.title: Saw these in a hotel and wanted some
customer_reviews.text: Not disapponted! Small enuff, bright enuff. Because they are on the thin side, they are easier to staore until needed.
customer_reviews.author: Joe S.

customer_reviews.title: Replaces your 60 watt incandescent but won't dim as much.
customer_reviews.text: These bulbs are the perfect replacement for my incandescent bulbs. They are slightly brighter than the 60 watt incandescents I used before. There are different shades of color but I think the "Soft White" is the most comfortable. If you calculate the price over the lifetime of the bulb they are cheaper than CF or Incandescent bulbs, plus you get energy savings. The only negatives are they do not dim as low as a regular incandescents (I have found this to be true to all LED bulbs) and the packaging is a little difficult to open.
customer_reviews.author: vluken

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Product
customer_reviews.text: These lights have a cool design. At the price they are, it makes sense to purchase one of these instead of a CFL. They produce good light, more like an incandescent, and respond well to all dimmers. The diffuser that surrounds the LEDs seem to be the heat exchanger as well. When you turn the lights out after they have been on a while, the plastic makes a noise.
customer_reviews.author: Graham

product_meta.title: Philips 452978 60-Watt Equivalent SlimStyle A19 LED Light Bulb Soft White, Dimmable
product_meta.description:
Style:60 Watt Equivalent Soft White| Size:1 Pack

PHILIPS 433227 10.5-WATT SLIM STYLE DIMMABLE A19 LED LIGHT BULB, SOFT WHITE 
SLIM DOWN YOUR ENERGY COSTS WITH SLIMSTYLE
The SlimStyle household LED not only uses less energy than traditional light sources, but also comes at an irresistible price. Philips SlimStyle LED light bulbs have a low wattage that uses between 80 and 83 percent less energy than incandescent light bulbs, but with the same light quality. This modern, efficient LED alternative to incandescent will bring you savings for years to come.

SlimStyle provides a soft, comfortable light within your homeView larger Fits easilly into existing household fixturesView larger INNOVATIVE DESIGN, IRRESISTIBLE PRICE
SlimStyle’s unique and durable shape provides quality light at an affordable price. SlimStyle features a sleek and modern design while providing all-around light. It is an easy and efficient switch from standard bulbs and fits into medium base fixtures. Just by turning on the switch, your room is at full brightness with no slow starting or waiting. Use it with most dimmers to create your desired ambiance with a broad range of dimming. With soft white light, you can create a comfortable, inviting atmosphere within your home.

ENERGY-EFFICIENT REPLACEMENT FOR TRADITIONAL BULBS
You won’t have to worry about the hassle of frequently replacing your light bulbs with SlimStyle’s long lifetime of 22.8 years – lasting 96% longer than an incandescent. This is based off an average use of 3 hours per day, 7 days per week. Compare its life of 25,000 hours to an incandescent bulb that lasts less than one year, or around 1,000 hours.

SAFE AND SUSTAINABLE ALTERNATIVE
SlimStyle’s rugged design ensures durability and is safe for the environment and for your home. It not only reduces your energy costs, but has a durable design that is mercury-free and safe for your family to use. Since it emits no UV/IR light, it will not harm or fade your fabrics and furnishings. A simple switch can make a difference in your home and the environment. This bulb is not suitable for totally enclosed fixtures and is not compatible with photo controls, occupancy sensors or timing devices.

PHILIPS FAMILY OF LED LIGHT BULBS
The Philips family of LED light bulbs delivers huge energy savings from the brand you trust. Switching to high efficiency LED lighting can help reduce your electric bill, minimize maintenance costs all while preserving our environment. Philips LED provides increased life when compared to less-efficient incandescent light sources. They improve ambiance, energy-efficiency and comfort in your home while delivering performance you can count on.

Philips SlimStyle has a new unique, innovative design.View larger MAKE A STATEMENT WITH A SLEEK NEW LOOK
The unique flat shape of the Philips SlimStyle LED allows it to be used anywhere a traditional A19 light bulb is used, without compromising light quality. It can be used in household applications including table and floor lamps, wall sconces, and open pendant fixtures. It is dimmable and can be used with most dimmers to create your desired ambiance.


INNOVATIVE DESIGN
 * Use it for an impressive design statement and all-around light 
 * Slim shape fits in your existing medium base fixtures 
 * Experience a broad range of dimming 
 * Mercury-free and rugged design is ideal for homes with children
feature_bullets: This Philips 60 Watt equivalent consumes 10.5 watts of energy, saving you up to $136.13 in energy costs
New sleek, flat design is ideal for use in wall sconces, table and floor lamps, open pendant or ceiling fixtures
Extra long lifetime of 22.8 years - reduces the hassle of frequent replacement
Safe for the environment and your home - durable design and mercury-free
Dimmable and provides a soft, comfortable light
